a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif;font-weight:500

text.tspan: National poverty line vs. GDP per capita, 2017
The horizontal lines indicate poverty lines set by the World Bank to be representative of national definitions of poverty
adopted low, lower middle and upper middle income countries respectively.
Data source: Jolliffe et al. (2022); World Bank
Note: This data is expressed in international-$ at 2017 prices, and is therefore adjusted for inflation and for differences in the cost of living
